intro: Antidesma jongkindii, commonly known as the African starfruit tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped fruits that resemble those of the common starfruit. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are unisexual and clustered in dense inflorescences. The fruit is edible, though its taste and texture can vary depending on the variety and ripeness.
